p: In 2006, it was estimated that by 2015, 400,000 Spanish inhabitants would suffer AMD, and more than one million could be at risk [ 50]. This reached 700,000 people in 2016 (1.5% of the Spanish population), almost twice as many as expected. Other factors which increase the risk of AMD are malnutrition and undernourishment [ 88]. Adverse and extreme climate events all over Spain are linked to a subsequent increase in agricultural, fruit and vegetable prices, which are essential to prevent the development of pathologies such as AMD and Glaucoma [ 89, 90]. The annual burden of AMD is 8300 euros/patient, and half of this (48%) must be borne by the patients and their families.
